Name: Get-WinAcceptLanguageFromLanguageListOptOut
Synopsis: Gets the HTTP Accept Language from the Language List opt-out setting for the current user account.

Name: Get-WinCultureFromLanguageListOptOut
Synopsis: Gets the Culture (User Locale) from the language list opt-out setting for the current user account.

Name: Get-WinDefaultInputMethodOverride
Synopsis: Gets the default input method override setting for the current user account.

Name: Get-WinHomeLocation
Synopsis: Gets the Windows GeoID home location setting for the current user account.

Name: Get-WinLanguageBarOption
Synopsis: Gets the language bar mode and language bar type for the current user account.

Name: Get-WinSystemLocale
Synopsis: Gets the System-locale setting (that is, the language for non-Unicode programs) for the current computer.

Name: Get-WinUILanguageOverride
Synopsis: Gets the Windows user interface (UI) language override setting for the current user account.

Name: Get-WinUserLanguageList
Synopsis: Gets the language list for the current user account.

Name: New-WinUserLanguageList
Synopsis: Instantiates a new language list object.

Name: Set-Culture
Synopsis: Sets the user culture for the current user account.

Name: Set-WinAcceptLanguageFromLanguageListOptOut
Synopsis: Sets the HTTP Accept Language from the Language List opt-out setting for the current user account.

Name: Set-WinCultureFromLanguageListOptOut
Synopsis: Sets the Culture (User Locale) from language list opt out setting for the current user account.

Name: Set-WinDefaultInputMethodOverride
Synopsis: Sets the default input method override for the current user account.

Name: Set-WinHomeLocation
Synopsis: Sets the home location setting for the current user account.

Name: Set-WinLanguageBarOption
Synopsis: Sets the language bar type and mode for the current user account.

Name: Set-WinSystemLocale
Synopsis: Sets the system locale (the language for non-Unicode programs) for the current computer.

Name: Set-WinUILanguageOverride
Synopsis: Sets the Windows user interface (UI) language override setting for the current user account.

Name: Set-WinUserLanguageList
Synopsis: Sets the language list and associated properties for the current user account.
